summary: This document is a forwarded email chain containing a news article from The Telegraph about federal prosecutors in the Southern District of New York requesting a halt to a civil lawsuit against Ghislaine Maxwell. The prosecutors argue the civil case jeopardizes the criminal prosecution due to factual overlap and risks exposing witnesses and investigation details. The article also mentions other related civil proceedings.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: British heiress facing child sex trafficking charges; accused of grooming minor girls for Jeffrey Epstein. She is detained in federal prison and has pleaded not guilty.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Disgraced late financier who was arrested on sex-trafficking charges and found dead in his prison cell. His estate is worth an estimated $577 million and is being sued by victims.

persons.name: Jane Doe
persons.context: Pseudonym for a woman, now 40, who filed a civil lawsuit against Ghislaine Maxwell. She alleges she was groomed and sexually abused by Epstein and Maxwell starting at age 13 in 1994.

persons.name: Josie Ensor
persons.context: Reporter for The Telegraph who wrote the article about prosecutors seeking to halt the civil proceedings against Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Patricia Hurtado
persons.context: Bloomberg journalist who forwarded the Telegraph story in the email chain.

persons.name: Robert Glassman
persons.context: Lawyer representing Jane Doe in the civil lawsuit against Ghislaine Maxwell. He argued against a stay, stating his client wants to press forward for justice.

persons.name: Virginia Roberts Giuffre
persons.context: A victim of Jeffrey Epstein who filed a civil defamation case against Ghislaine Maxwell. A court is due to hear arguments about unsealing sensitive evidence in her case.

connections.description: Maxwell allegedly groomed minor girls for abuse by Epstein in the mid-1990s, according to the criminal indictment and civil suit.
Jane Doe's civil lawsuit alleges Maxwell groomed and facilitated her abuse by Epstein starting when she was 13.
Jane Doe alleges she was subjected to years of sexual abuse by Epstein after being groomed by him and Maxwell.
Robert Glassman is the lawyer representing Jane Doe in her civil lawsuit against Ghislaine Maxwell.
Giuffre has filed a civil defamation case against Maxwell, with a court hearing scheduled on unsealing evidence.

events.title: Prosecutors Request Halt to Civil Case
events.description: Federal prosecutors from the Southern District of New York file a letter arguing the civil lawsuit against Ghislaine Maxwell should be stayed because it jeopardizes the criminal case due to factual overlap and risks exposing witnesses and investigation details.

events.title: Alleged Grooming of Jane Doe Begins
events.description: Jane Doe, then 13, alleges she was first approached by Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell at a summer camp in Michigan, beginning a months-long grooming process.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein Arrest
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is arrested on multiple sex-trafficking charges.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is found dead in his prison cell approximately five weeks after his arrest.

events.title: Scheduled Hearing in Giuffre Defamation Case
events.description: A court in Manhattan is due to hear oral arguments in the civil defamation case filed by Virginia Roberts Giuffre against Ghislaine Maxwell, regarding whether to unseal sensitive evidence.

keyFacts: Federal prosecutors argued that allowing a civil lawsuit against Ghislaine Maxwell to proceed would jeopardize the criminal case against her due to significant factual overlap.
The civil plaintiff, Jane Doe, alleges she was groomed at age 13 by Epstein and Maxwell in 1994 at a Michigan summer camp and then subjected to years of sexual abuse.
Prosecutors warned that civil discovery could expose facts about the criminal investigation, preview trial testimony, and potentially expose witnesses to harassment.
Jeffrey Epstein's estate is worth an estimated $577 million, and a number of his victims are suing the estate for compensation.
A separate civil defamation case filed by Virginia Roberts Giuffre against Maxwell has a hearing scheduled for September 22, 2020, regarding unsealing sensitive evidence.
